questionnaire.name: HubSpot Implementation Discovery v3.0
questionnaire.description: Master version of the questionnaire as of 13 October 2025.  Includes revisions to the General Details and Systems & Data Inventory sections.

questions.text: Title of scope
questions.subtext: Add deal name

questions.text: Sales Manager
What is triggering this project and what are the goals?
questions.subtext: Please provide some details about what is triggering this project and what are the overarching business goals that it is supporting, as well as the specific project goals the client is aiming to achieve

questions.text: What are the key triggers for this project?
Other Trigger
questions.subtext: If "Other" is chosen above, please describe the trigger.

questions.text: Describe Your Goals
questions.subtext: E.g. create efficiencies, increase leads by x, increase revenue...

questions.text: Project Start Date
Desired Go Live Date
What factors are driving or influencing the start date and / or the go live date of the project?
How many distinct business divisions or units are included in this HubSpot implementation?
questions.subtext: Identify any parts of the business that operate independently or follow unique processes (e.g., different brands, product lines, or regional teams). This helps us understand whether separate HubSpot configurations, data access rules, or even portals might be required.  This only needs to be answered if there is more than one.

questions.text: How many distinctive Brand identities are included in this scope. Please describe.
questions.subtext: Include a link to brand guidelines/ further information on ICP, competitors, and product /service portolio. How many Brand domains or subdomains are currently in use and is there a strategy for how many are planned for the future?

questions.text: Which front office functions will be impacted by or included in this project? (Include those beyond the defined scope if relevant.)
questions.subtext: This question clarifies which departments or business functions are in and not in scope for the project. A good answer selects all relevant functions such as marketing, sales, customer service, and customer success. Understanding this helps define the breadth of implementation and consulting effort.

questions.text: What compliance, regulatory, data privacy or other legal frameworks form part of your requirements? (E.g. GdpR, HIPPA, CCPA...)
Will you have one central project manager who will be the primary point of contact on your side?
Who are your stakeholders who will be actively working on this project?
For key Huble project roles, please specify your language preference:
Post go-live, how will ongoing change management as well as solution maintainance and optimisation be handled?
In the instance that we do require more hours on the project than originally estimated, how would you like to fund / manage this?
What are your current challenges/ which known limitations should we be aware of?
questions.subtext: (e.g. low adoption of current CRM  / limitations in marketing automation capabilities / data quality / misalignment of current sales/marketing/service processes...)

questions.text: 1. Please describe any project meeting requirements that we should align with (e.g. standing meeting frequencies).
Should Huble collaborate with you using your internal tools (e.g., Teams, Slack, Jira) in addition to our project management system? If so, please list each tool and its intended use.
Budget Reporting: As standard, Huble will report on budget burndown twice monthly. Do you require budget reporting more frequently than that?
Budget Reporting: Huble's standard budget reporting shows budget consumed vs project total. If you have any custom budget reporting requirements, please describe?

Project Governance: Huble will conduct a Project RACI, Stakeholder Mapping and weekly Risk and Issue Reporting. If you have any other specific or custom reporting or governance requirements, please describe
Is there a project steering committee? (Governance - not operational)
What is the desired frequency of the steering committee meeting or would you like Huble to make a recommendation?'
questions.subtext: Recommendation = Quarterly

questions.text: Is your business already using HubSpot?
If Yes, Which functions are currently on HubSpot?
If your business is using HubSpot, please describe your current use of HubSpot, including the following.
questions.subtext:
Please describe your current use of HubSpot, including the following.

- How many HubSpot Portals are in use?
- What HubSpot products (Hubs) are currently in use?
- How many total records are in your CRM?
- Are you utilizing custom objects in your HubSpot portal?
- Approximately how many workflows are active in your portal?
- How many integrations with external systems are currently configured?
- What is the total number of users with access to your HubSpot portal?
- How would you describe the overall complexity of your HubSpot setup?

questions.text: Please provide information for any other system that is relevant to this project. Please include systems that are currently in use as well as new systems that are planned to be implemented as part of this project.
questions.subtext: Please include any AI systems or LLM's that you have licenses for.

questions.text: Please list any data that requires migration.
Please list any domains that need to be connected to HubSpot
questions.subtext: Please leave this out if there are no domains to be connected to HubSpot.

questions.text: Do you have an internal IT team or external provider who manages your DNS?
questions.subtext: This helps us understand whether or not you are able to manage DNS updates such as connecting your domains to HubSpot.

questions.text: Are you aware of any potential downtime or critical dependencies we should consider when connecting domains?
questions.subtext: Ths is only relevant if there are domains which need to be connected to HubSpot

questions.text: If relevant, please advise if there are any organizational policies, compliance requirements, or constraints that we should be aware of when proposing new systems (e.g., data security standards, regulatory compliance, preferred vendors, restrictions,  IT signoff)?
Please advise whether there are any organizational policies, compliance requirements, or constraints when it comes to granting Huble staff and contractors access to your systems.
Does your organization currently utilize any middleware or iPaaS solutions for system integrations (e.g., message buses, integration platforms like Zapier or N8N)?
If Yes, Please specify the middleware or iPaaS solutions in use and describe their purpose within your integration architecture.
Should these tools be leveraged for any new integrations, or may Huble suggest new tools?

Please describe any preferences or requirements regarding the technologies, programming languages, or platforms that may be used for developing integrations (e.g., PHP, containerized systems, specific iPaaS platforms)?
Does your organization have a preference for managing & maintaining custom integrations internally, or would you prefer these integrations to be managed by Huble?
If you have in-house development or engineering resources, would you prefer to handle custom development internally and engage Huble for technical consulting only?
Would you like configuration in a Sandbox environment to be completed before moving to the live environment?
How would you like to approach user acceptance testing (UAT)?
What type of Incidental technical documentation would you like to be produced during the project to facilitate alignment on scope and requirements?
What type of Technical Documentation would you like to be delivered in a Project Handover Pack?
questions.subtext:
This question determines the customer's expectations for final documentation to be provided at the conclusion of the project. A good answer specifies the artefacts they wish to receive and the level of detail required — distinguishing between basic and comprehensive documentation.

**Basic documentation** typically includes simple summaries such as configuration overviews, object lists, property dictionaries, and basic workflow descriptions sufficient for general orientation.

**Comprehensive documentation** includes detailed field mappings, process logic documentation, configuration rationales, custom code or integration specs, permission structures, data migration audit reports, and any known limitations or future considerations.

Customers should clarify which approach they expect for each artefact (e.g. basic field documentation but comprehensive integration specs).

questions.text: Data Models
Property Descriptions & Mapping
Functional & Technical Specifications
Systems & Data Architecture Specifications
Data Migration Reports
Users & Permissions
Systems Configuration Documentation
1. Talk us through your typical customer journeys
questions.subtext:
Objective: A guided discussion in this manner helps to identify relevance of and answers to many of the questions below.
Identify key channels being used, how leads are qualified, what nurturing activities are used, how leads are handed over to sales, what information is fed back from sales to marketing

questions.text: 1.b. Define your primary marketing challenges
2. Identify requirements in relation to your marketing processes (If multiple variations of process by division/ BU/ Product/ region, add one line for each)
3. Please list and describe the different roles and their requirements in this department.
4. Describe Template Requirements
5. Provide details on Marketing Requirements including Channels + Assets
6. Provide Details on Paid Media Requirements
7. Describe Training & Enablement requirements
8. To ensure that that we align to your preferences and internal change management style. What Types of Training Documentation do you prefer?
9. In addition to defined integrations and UI extensions, do you have additional custom requirements that need to be taken into consideration (e.g. calculator/ geomapping...)
What are the key Marketing KPIs that you measure?
questions.subtext: E.g. Leads generated by source, lead journey progress, MQL to SQL conversion rate, Revenue attribution to marketing activities,

questions.text: 1. Talk us through your typical buying processes (lead to customer journeys)
2. Describe your Sales Processes
questions.subtext: If multiple variations of process by division/ BU/ Product/ region, add one line for each

questions.text: What are the key KPIs that you measure for your sales processes?
questions.subtext: E.g. Opportunity to close converstion, activity metrics, funnel progression, pipeline progression, time in stage metrics. average deal size, revenue by product, revenue by channel.

questions.text: 3. Describe your primary Sales Challenges
questions.subtext: e.g. Prospecting, efficiency, adoption...

questions.text: 4. If your business has a dedicated outbound sales function, please answer the following questions.
questions.subtext: (E.g. focused on proactive outreach to cold or semi-warm leads rather than responding to inbound enquiries)

questions.text: 5. How is your outbound sales function structured?
6. In addition to HubSpot, do you use additional tools/platforms for outbound prospecting and engagement, if so, please define?
questions.subtext: e.g. Salesloft, Zoominfo, Outreach, Apollo.io, specific dialers, etc.

questions.text: Section Divider
Please list and describe the different roles and their requirements in this department.

Please select all relevant sales channels and assets.

questions.subtext:
Do you allow your full sales team to see all information & activities relating to other teams' deals, or do you have restrictions?

Are there any legal requirements that govern who is able to see what sales data across your organization?

Product library requirements

What product-related considerations exist?

Talk us through your typical service customer journeys
Define your primary Service challenges
Describe your Service Processes
questions.subtext: If multiple variations of process by division/ BU/ Product/ region, add one line for each

questions.text: Please list and describe the different roles and their requirements in this department.
Describe your desired Service Use Cases (Process Drivers)
Describe all Service channels + Assets

questions.subtext:
Do you allow your full service team to see all information & activities relating to other teams' tickets, or do you have restrictions?

questions.text: Describe your preferred Training & Enablement requirements
To ensure that that we align to your preferences and internal change management style. What Types of Training Documentation do you prefer?
In addition to defined integrations and UI extensions, do you have additional custom requirements that need to be taken into consideration (e.g. geomapping, multi-language)
Please let us know what CRM & Technology Strategic Consulting you would like.
questions.subtext:
- **Data Strategy & Governance** Focuses on the quality, structure, security, and compliance of customer data across systems—ensuring HubSpot can serve as a trusted system of record.
- **Front Office Systems Architecture** Focuses on how tools connect, how data flows, and how HubSpot fits into your broader front-office architecture as a central platform.
- **Change Control & Platform Governance** Focuses on how HubSpot is managed, evolved, and governed over time to support consistency, control, and long-term scalability.

questions.text: Please list and describe the administrator and IT roles that are in addition to the sales, service and marketing users already listed
Is there a need for any data in HubSpot to be enriched?
We can implement automation to help identify, clean, and standardise data across your CRM. Please indicate which of the following we should include.
questions.subtext:
- **Preventing duplicate records** (e.g. duplicate contacts, companies, or deals)
- **Standardising data formats** (e.g. country names, phone numbers, capitalisation)
- **Flagging incomplete or incorrect records** (e.g. missing contact owner, invalid email address)
- **Ongoing cleanup routines** (e.g. archive stale deals, flag inactive contacts)
- **Automated validation or correction workflows** (e.g. auto-filling missing fields or reassigning based on logic)

questions.text: Please describe the above automation in more detail and provide any additional automation required.
Does HubSpot need to handle and store sensitive or regulated information (e.g., personal identification information, financial data, health records)?
What are your requirements for data backup and recovery for HubSpot?
Describe your Training & Enablement requirements
To ensure that we align to your preferences and internal change management style. What Types of Training Documentation do you prefer?
In addition to defined integrations and UI extensions, do you have additional custom requirements that need to be taken into consideration (e.g. geomapping, multi-language)
